page.title: 04Ley Farm Strensham
page.content: {Ley Farm}is situated down a large track with arable land on either side of the lane. The house itself is very old, probably about 1680's. It has been vacant for some time and is in a poor state of repair. Surrounding the house is 7 acres of grassland. This is at present lying fallow. The new owners of{Ley Farm}have only been in residence four weeks (1/10/85). There is a lot to be done. A new bathroom and kitchen are being installed. The present owners have plans to become self-sufficient on their farm by burning rubbish and straw and turning it into methane gas. This will be stored and later used via a generator to produce light and heat. The immediate grounds around the house have been tidied and laid to lawn. The buildings are in a poor state but in time this is to be put right.
